page.title: 01LIFE IN EDAY
page.content: Eday is one of the smaller north isles of Orkney. It has a central position and a population of roughly 140 people. The area contained within this block is mostly hill land with many birds nesting along the cliffs and seals in the surrounding sea. The land is used for farming, mainly beef and sheep with some barley grown. There are one or two fairly large farms and many small crofts. Much of the land has recently been fenced and some of the rough hill land has been cultivated as grazing. There is a considerable amount of peat on this land which is used as the main source of heating on the island. The peat is cut in the late spring and, given favourable weather conditions, brought down from the hill in late summer.
